sen.j: 壬生浪士（みぶろうし）あるいは精忠浪士(せいちゅうろうし)は、新選組の前身集団。
sen.e: Mibu Roshi, or Seichu Roshi, is a predecessor group of the Shinsengumi.
Mibu Roshi, or Seichu Roshi, is a predecessor of the Shinsengumi group.
Mibu Roshi, or Seichu Roshi, is a predecessor of the Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 新撰組の説明補足group削除

sen.j: 文久三年（1863年）清河八郎が京へ率いた浪士組が東帰した後も、京（現在の京都府京都市）に残った24名で構成。
sen.e: Hachiro KIYOKAWA led a group of roshi (masterless samurai) to Kyoto, and when Kiyokawa 's group returned to Tokyo, 24 members remained in Kyoto organized Mibu Roshi group in 1863.
Hachiro KIYOKAWA led a group of roshi (masterless samurai) to Kyoto, and when Kiyokawa 's group returned to Tokyo, 24 members remained in Kyoto to organize Mibu Roshi group in 1863.
Hachiro KIYOKAWA led a group of roshi (masterless samurai) to Kyoto, and when Kiyokawa 's group returned to Tokyo, 24 members remained in Kyoto to organize Mibu Roshi group in 1863.

sen.j: 構成内容は以下参照。
sen.e: See below for a list of the members.
See below for a list of the members.
See below for a list of the members.

sen.j: 新選組となる以前の壬生浪士たちは身なりの貧しさから、「みぼろ」（壬生浪＝みぶろ・みぶろう）と一部の京の人たちに揶揄されていた。
sen.e: Before they formed the Shinsengumi, these roshi were made fun of as Miboro (meaning raggedy clothes) because of the poor state of their appearance.
Before they formed the Shinsengumi, these roshi were made fun of as Miboro (meaning raggedy clothes) because of the poor state of their appearance.
Before they formed the Shinsengumi, these roshi were made fun of as 'Miboro (meaning raggedy clothes)' because of the poor state of their appearance.

sen.j: 「壬生の狼」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: They were also called the "Mibu no Okami (Raggedy Wolves)"
They were also called the "Mibu no Okami (Raggedy Wolves)"
They were also called the 'Mibu no Okami (Raggedy Wolves)'.

sen.j: また、女性隊士がいたという説もある。
sen.e: Some say there were female members.
Some say there were female members.
Some say there were female members.

sen.j: 創設メンバー24名。
sen.e: 24 members at the foundation
24 founding members.
24 founding members.

Serizawa group
Serizawa group

Kamo SERIZAWA: Died September 18, 1863 in an attack by Hijikata.
Kamo SERIZAWA: Died September 18, 1863 in a surprise attack by Hijikata and other members.
